website_summaries.verdict: A solid boot that keeps little feet warm in extreme winter conditions.
pros: Heavy tread provides traction on ice
Velcro strap makes it easy for kids to take them on and off
Excellent insulation works in extreme temperatures
cons: The seams lack the durability of more expensive boots
Sizes for older kids may be out of stock

customer_reviews.title: What the heck?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 9 year old son for an upcoming trip to the snow. We checked fit and put them away until our trip. Today was the day, so we got him all dressed and headed out. First and foremost, his feet stayed dry. However, after a day of playing in the snow I noticed he had something coming off the sole. It appears the soles tread is made of fabric?!!! They were literally falling apart. I am disappointed and won't recommend this pair of boots to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaDudesWife

customer_reviews.title: We purchased these because we needed them quickly and they had great ratings, however
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has only used these boots for a week and already the bottom of the boot is coming apart. There is fabric separating from the waterproof/rubber bottom, causing a "fuzzy layer" to form over the bottom of the boot. Because of this, the boots have no traction and my daugter is slipping all over the place. I tried removing all of the "fuzz", but more keeps coming; presumably from inside the boot. These boots will be thrown out and replaced with a different kind. We purchased these because we needed them quickly and they had great ratings, however, they are certainly no good for our snowy Minnesota winters.
customer_reviews.author: JBens23

customer_reviews.title: Snow buildup
customer_reviews.text: These boots kept my 3.5 year old's feet dry for our weekend in the snow and fit as expected. However, she had a buildup of snow, making it hard for her to walk (see pic). I wouldn't buy these again, but they served their purpose for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots are awful. My son has been only ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awful. My son has been only wearing these for a month and all the seams are coming apart on the outside and inside of boot.
customer_reviews.author: Hung T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit as long as you MEASURE MEASURE MEASURE!
customer_reviews.text: I always read through these reviews before purchasing ANYTHING and yes some of the comments made me a little worried BUT I will tell you these boots actually DID fit PERFECTLY. I have 2 boys, a 4 year old size 11 toddler, and a 6 year old in a 12 toddler and the boots truly fit. Advice for the worriers...MEASURE YOUR CHILD'S SHOES. There are guides that tell you measurements so def use them. You won't be disappointed. Both of my children would not take these boots off when I put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots. Questionable delivery.
customer_reviews.text: The boot itself serves its purpose. Only needed it for the weekend in the snow but with this rainy weather my daughter has some heavy duty rain boots. Only problem was the delivery. Not sure who is at fault but when amazon notifies me that my package has been "Hand delivered to a resident" and I'm frantically looking for my box and find it in my backyard with my dogs...well I don't know if I should just laugh since they are residents or be pissed that my package could've gotten torn up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: The boot had potential to be lightweight, but had to be returned due to it being the typical heavy snow boot. The weight should have been included in the description as I wouldn’t have purchased the item had I known ahead of time how heavy it is. It might be better for an older child, but the weight of it for a toddler just wasn’t practical.
customer_reviews.author: D g

customer_reviews.title: Snow boot that disintegrates in snow...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to say that after 2 hours of use walking through very light snow (just playing in snowpark) that the soles of the show have become HAIRY! Yes...hairy. At first I thought my son discovered the next intact Mammuthus primigenius as his footsteps left little black hairy patches on the path we were walking on, but to my disappointment it appears that the soles are disintegrating into a hairy fibrous mess. I'm not sure what material is being used to make the soles of these boots, but apparently they break down under snowy and watery conditions. That's not a good thing...especially for snow boots. To be quite honest I have never seen a snow boot do that before...huge letdown.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Was a bit worried after reading some reviews about the bottoms of these boots but so far these haven't shredded on the bottom for my son. We bought this brand last winter for my other son and they lasted all winter. And he wore them every day in Wisconsin winter on his school playground which typically destroys any and all winter clothes and shoes and jeans! Will continue buying this brand of boots.
customer_reviews.author: jennah

customer_reviews.title: These Boots Don't Work for Real Winters
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these boots because of the price point, and they do fit well, but the quality just doesn't seem to be very good. We live in the North East and get real winters with lots of snow and -20 degree temps and these boots just don't cut it. They aren't waterproof. My daughter's socks are always wet after playing outside in these boots and when the snow is packy it sticks to the bottom of the boots and makes these huge snowballs on the bottom of her boots and then she can't walk in them. It's weird...I've never seen any other boots do that.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica T.

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow opening
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking boot. It’s not as tall as on the leg as some of the other brands, which is good for short legs. Only downside is that the entry into the boot is narrow and fixed so fitting the child’s foot and leg inside, especially with thick socks can be challenging. If you’re child’s calves are a little on the thick side you might want to consider a boot with elastic at the top or wider opening than this one. Otherwise, it’s a good option for a low priced snow boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, easy to put on, but TERRIBLE in snow
customer_reviews.text: Had a trip up to the mountains during winter. Needed to make sure the toddler is able to stay warm and have fun running around in the snow. It was super easy to put on the toddler, and it also felt warm for 40 degrees. However once in the snow, my toddler might as well be wearing ice skates. Snow gets stuck on the bottom of the shoe, leaving it without any traction. I had to carry my toddler for most of the trip or used a stroller. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Terrible traction snow clumps up on bottom
customer_reviews.text: The boots fit fine and kept my son's feet warm and dry however the traction on the bottom as some sort of fabric which was causing the snow to stick to the bottom of the boots and clump up. He was sliding and tripping because the snow was balling into ice on the bottom of this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Lowin

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, feels good...
customer_reviews.text: Trying to find some affordable quality boots, and came across these. So many colours and designs. The fit is right, it looks bulky and larger than actual size but because of that, they actually do fit right, especially if your planning insulated socks for your little one. Wish the ankle straps could tighten a little more but I do like the bungie strap on top. My daughter likes them, she is 2. And we will find out how long they last. They do seem to keep my daughter feet warm and dry. Pictures are to show look and style. Practicality her snow pant would cover the boot. ;)
customer_reviews.author: L. John

customer_reviews.title: Loved these snow boots so much I have bought them ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved these snow boots so much I have bought them now 2 years running. We live in MN, so no strangers to snow. It's important that the small has warm toes and gets to go outside too. The tread on these is outstanding, even on icy days I'm not worried. I've thrown them in the wash on gentle when the small goes mud-puddling and they come out just fine. What a value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lane

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous & warm boots for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I wish these boots came in my size. My 8-year-old loves them and wore them for Girl Scout camp where she spent most of a very cold weekend outside in the rain and mud with a little snow. The boots stayed nice and cleaned up easily and most importantly, kept her feet warm and dry. I recommend them for any little girl. Definitely size up though. I think I went up a whole size or maybe even two and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Ziegmont

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to wear for babies. But still a solid pair of boots for snow and ice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boot for my 18 MO and it was very very difficult for me to put it on for him. Once his feet enters the boot, I can't tell where his feet is and if it has reached the bottom of the boot. It's just too difficult. Having said that, this is a solid pair of boots. I recommend it for anyone with an older child, or toddlers who can put on the boot by themselves. When worn correctly, my son walks very happily and comfortably. His feet is also very warm and dry when we remove it. We live in Colorado and we've used it on snow and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: C Z

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Good
customer_reviews.text: These boots seem to be of good quality and have so far held up well in the few snow outdoor excursions my almost 2-year old has gone on. I was at first impressed with the tread on these boots, but I soon realized that they have a tendency to collect snow and it gets packed all around the bottom of the boot until my two year old can no longer walk or even stand up. (Thus a knock-down to 4 stars) it’s easy enough to pull off the snow, but it is a pain to have to do it every so often while he’s outside. Otherwise, I like everything else about the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H.

customer_reviews.title: I was happy with the way these fit and stayed on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the way these fit and stayed on my son’s feet so that they were fairly easy for him to walk in. They seemed to keep his feet warm and dry the first day we used them, but on day two his socks were soaked after only a half hour of use (snow did not get in from the top as his snow pants remained snuggly secured around the ankle of the boot) so they obviously leaked while he was playing in the melting snow.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Where we live it generally only snows 2-3 times a year so they won't be getting much use but I wanted boots anyway so he can comfortably play out in the snow
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size 2 little kids for my 6 year old who wears a size 13.5 shoe. I wanted a larger size so he can wear thick socks with them and so hopefully we can get more than one year out of these boots. Where we live it generally only snows 2-3 times a year so they won't be getting much use but I wanted boots anyway so he can comfortably play out in the snow. We went out in the snow today and he said they were comfortable and warm so I'm happy with this purchase and the size I ended up getting.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: A size up works best for us
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had a lot of weather to try these out in, so I may update later, but here is what we know so far: My son needed a size larger than normal for his boots (we ordered a different brand and the boots fit his younger brother...big brother is 5, younger brother is 3), so when we decided to try these, I went a size bigger and they fit him well. They seem comfortable and, while we haven't tried them in big puddles and muddy playgrounds, they are doing a good job so far. They fit and seem like they will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Tats76

customer_reviews.title: Decent winter boots
customer_reviews.text: Easy for my daughter to pull on and cute designs. They worked well for mild winter conditions ( we live in upstate NY) but had to buy more insulated ones for the bitter cold days. She prefers these over the columbia ones, as long as its over 30 degrees they seem to keep her feet warm m
customer_reviews.author: insert clever name here

customer_reviews.title: Great Toddler Snow Boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my toddler for the Colorado snow season and I was satisfied with my purchase. I did by a half size bigger than his true size but that was because I wanted to be able to fit his thick winter socks in there. Although my toddler couldn’t explain how much he enjoys his snow boots, I think they were a good fit. They might be a bit heavy, because he did trudge around in these a little bit, but the heavy-duty material kept his toes warm so I’m not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Burman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: So far these are the best snow boots my girl has owned. We always had her in $10-$15 boots in the snow and she had survived in inches and inches of snow but these ones have actual thinsulate for outdoor play. As I would expect from any snow boot, they will be tighter on the inside. If your kid has chubby feet or you make them wear very thick socks in Winter, size up.
customer_reviews.author: Diany Moony

customer_reviews.title: Fit true to size, great for cold winters and active kids
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my 6 year old son who has average foot width size (not wide or narrow) He wears a size 2 and these fit him perfectly and have all winter. We live in Maine and it gets very cold (in the negatives often and these keep his feet warm and dry! They are easy to get on and off, work for my sensory sensitive kiddo and work as promised.
customer_reviews.author: hd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect winter boot for snow fun
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my daughter to match her aqua snow bibs. They fit perfectly and can tighten across the top of the foot if needed. The design is fun and different, and these kept my daughter's toes warm and toasty. I also like the drawstring feature at the top which helps to keep the wet snow on the outside of the boot, not on the inside! There is a nice tread at the bottom which minimizes slipping... and that's a good thing considering how much sledding and snowboarding she does in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bowen

customer_reviews.title: bought for a ski trip
customer_reviews.text: Despite other negative reviews regarding quality, we had no problems with this boot. As a matter of fact, they were perfect for our trip to the snowy mountains of Colorado. We only used them for a week, but for that time, my son's feet stayed warm and dry, and the boots did not fall apart or deteriorate. Perfect for the price and intended use! I can see investing in a higher quality pair if you live in such colder climates, but otherwise, these guys did just the trick!
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Size up!
customer_reviews.text: I want to order these for a long time because of the quality ,but it kind of wasn't worth it because they are so small and narrow ,my son takes a size 13 and half in shoes so I ordered a 1 thinking it would fit just fine , definitely not and won't be able to layer socks ,so yes there a nice looking boot ,but they run small ,I suggest ordering a size or two up, unless you child has very small feet .I'm disappointed and now will have to find another pair somewhere else because there too small .
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Not for kiddos with thick calves!
customer_reviews.text: Not for kiddos with thick calves! I ordered a size up expecting my son to have room to grow into these, but we couldn’t even get his foot inside because the top part is so narrow. I will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect! My little boy is 3?and wear a size 9 or 10 in toddler in his regular shoes. I did measure his foot according to the size chailrt and it was a perfect fit. We walked around in about 5” + of snow and his feet stayed warm and dry. The next day we went hiking and he walked over a mile in them and they were perfect and kept him from slipping on melting ice. So happy I got these for my whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great for warmth!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm. Normal toe box and width. No arch support really but they’re snow boots so you’re not expecting hiking gear. Overall they fit well. I like that the elastic keeps the snow out. My toddler hates being cold and usually will call it quits about 15 minutes after being outside in sorels. I couldn’t get her to come back jnside she was never cold with these!!
customer_reviews.author: CCM08004

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. We have been buying bogs for our children up until this year when I wanted to save a little money. I found these and gave them a try. They are just as easy to put on. Son says they are comfortable and keep his foot warm and dry. Recommend for those looking for a winter boot without blowing out the entire budget.
customer_reviews.author: WWeber

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for snow!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new boots! He wears a 2,5 in Nike and after reading the reviews that they run small and need to order 2 sizes bigger I went ahead and ordered him size 4! Big mistake!! They were huge!!! So I gave those to my nephew who wears size 4 and they fit him perfectly! I reordered them in a size 3 and they fit my son perfect with room for thicker socks!! They are waterproof and keep his feet warm! They are true to size! No need to go bigger unless it's half a size!
customer_reviews.author: N M

customer_reviews.title: We are completely in love with this boot, brand and quality!
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND! My daughter is one and wears a size 5/6 and has VERY chubby and wide feet so I purchased a size 7 and they work perfect! She wants to constantly wear them and they work great for when she plays outside in the snow. The camo print is ABSOLUTELY adorable. We are completely in love with this boot, brand and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kyra

customer_reviews.title: Cute boots, but top material is too stiff to stay tightened around let.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for my 8 year old daughter and she loved them and the cute color and pattern. Due to the mild, practically snowless winter here in NH this year, she hasn't really gotten to play in the snow for me to really know if they will keep her feet dry and warm. I will update this review next winter. I do have one complaint, the shaft material is really stiff which makes it hard to tighten closed at the top and one boot always loosens up to where it gapes open around the leg. So I don't think it will keep the snow out when she's playing in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Catnh

customer_reviews.title: Nice, easy-on boots at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my toddler son and so far they've worked out well for him. They are pretty easy to get on and off, although I do have to help him, and they keep his feet dry in the snow. After an hour or so, he does tend to complain that his toes are getting cold, but at this price point, I think these boots are pretty good. If you live in an extremely cold climate, these may not be for you, but for temperatures in the 20s and 30s, these do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: If Your Little Ones Need Boots, buy these!!
customer_reviews.text: All of our grandkids needed snow boots for Christmas, these did the job for us! We bought 6 pair in a range of sizes, 1 girl, 5 boys. Great colors to choose from and every one of these fit little feet. Ages 5 years to 7 years. We could not get the kids to take them off until they got too hot! Great boots for the cold and all the snow we have. Feet stayed warm and dry. The price is good, fit good, feet warm. Best money Nana and Papa spent this year!!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Must be from China...
customer_reviews.text: These are one size bigger than my 3-year-old sons shoe size, by choice i figured they would be good until he is 4. They are wayyyyyy to tight by the ankle and my kid is thin not cartman fat yet they don't fit. waste of money make sure you guys buy something with a zipper. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Joezombi74

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get on
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and I like the straps but they are very hard to get on if your toddler has chubby feet. We had to buy something different.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Bogs are much better; These are Adequate
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend the money on the bogs. Bogs are much easier to get into and out of. Main issues with these is that when it snows, you really have to tighten them or put your snow pants over them because snow gets into top of them and your kids' get wet socks and toes. Otherwise fine. Wouldn't use a rain boot. Too bulky and cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I loved these - they were easy to get on my son's feet (age 4, size 11), stayed dry and warm, and fit properly. Going to buy a set for my daughter too. Great product. Updated: I got my daughter's boots today (age 8, size 2) and they fit perfectly too and she loved the rainbow stars and that she can put them on herself. I will definitely keep buying these boots as they outgrow theirs!
customer_reviews.author: McReader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect snow shoe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect snow shoe! They never slipped off and we're always comfortable. His feet stayed perfectly dry and warm, even when he ran through mud puddles repeatedly. What I also like about them is that after a weeks worth of wear, they became quite flexible and even more comfortable for him to use. Many toddler snow boots lack flexibility and I was concerned about this happening with these so I was pleasantly surprised when they broke in so well.
customer_reviews.author: on the watch

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two pairs of these for my 4 and 6 year olds for an upcoming show trip. Not only do they fit great and (according to the kids) are pretty easy to walk in, but they keep all moisture and snow out and even have a drawstring around the ankle. While my snow boots kept getting snow down into the tops, my kids feet stayed nice and dry! Great price and great purchase, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Azfitmomof5

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: We love these boots! We bought some last winter and sized up this winter. We’ll probably do the same next winter. With 3 boys I can’t afford to go all out on some sorrels or ll bean for kids. These work just fine keeping their feet warm and dry. Go on easy and stay on! Cute too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Storms

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed for a week in Breckenridge. My little ones feet were never cold and she still loves to wear them around the house, lol. Strap helped keep them tight and cinch at the top stopped snow from getting in.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E. Alva

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive pair of winter boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my four year old around Halloween as part of his Kylo Ren costume and he's been wearing them ever since then as winter boots. We live in Chicago and he gets plenty of use out of these. They are very warm, comfortable, easy for him to put on and take off, and very durable. They seem to fit pretty true to size for him. The price point on these was great, we hate spending too much on kids' shoes, especially seasonal ones, because the outgrow them too fast and we've already gotten our money's worth out of these.
customer_reviews.author: strugglebuggy

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old wore these while we were vacationing in the mountains. We spent 1-2 hours in the snow a few times per day and never had any issues with wet feet. They took a few minutes for her to get used to because they are much heavier than her normal shoes, but otherwise had no problems walking in them. She currently wears Stride Rite size 5 shoes, I purchased size 5 in this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, well made boots!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my sons, and they are great. Sometimes when you order online, the sizes are hard to gauge. But, they fit my kids perfectly. They definitely kept my kids' feet dry - protected from the snow, and then from the wet puddles/mush. The price is good too, because as with growing kids, you don't want to have to spend a lot of money since their feet will grow by the next winter season. They look great, and also made of sturdy material. As with all boots, it was hard for them to slip into. Not the boots' fault, but just the reality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeena116

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boot!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the drawstring,I love the firmness, I love the reflector on the back,this boot is awesome!! To big for my baby so I have to return but awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Ebonie wooten

customer_reviews.title: Run small due to insulation.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter measures a 1.5 youth and has a narrow foot. This means, we typically end up with size 1 or 1.5 after trying shoes on. I purchased a 2 to accommodate thick socks and MAYBE get two seasons out of them. However we had to get a 3 in these because the insulation took up a great deal of shoe room. They DO get wet in wet snow and take a while to dry out. It would be great if these had removable liners but for the price, these do the job.
customer_reviews.author: templetini

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: what a great investment! its warm, comfortable and sturdy! my toddler loves it! since its about 1/2 high from the floor and insulated, i don't have to worry about my LO feet getting wet or cold. my 2 year old walks great in these and never had an issue with it. I will definitely buy a size up for next winter. Living in MA, with the harsh winter is a must to own one of these. For the price and quality couldn't recommend it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Gilson&Esthwe

customer_reviews.title: Fits great with a pair of thick socks and keeps feet warm and dry!
customer_reviews.text: I ALMOST returned these boots because I thought they were a bit big on my two y/o daughter. The boots fit perfectly under a thick pair of wool socks and kept her feet dry and warm during a day of skiing and playing in the Colorado snow. Perfect!!! I’ll definitelt buy another pair of these next winter when her feet grow!
customer_reviews.author: C zhao

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, good quality, order a size up
customer_reviews.text: These are adorable, but run kind of small. The quality is great and sturdy, but unfortunately when you need your child to wear these, its cold so you put on thick socks. Thick socks make it nearly impossible to get the shoes on. Order a size or maybe 2 bigger so it fits. Or, they are lined pretty heavy so you don't necessarily need to double up on socks. Overall, super cute and durable. Worked great in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Prime member since 2010

customer_reviews.title: Great boots other than the ridiculous heel.
customer_reviews.text: Love the boots, only downside is they have a heel, what toddler or child needs a heel on their snow boots, seriously? If not for the heel I'd give 5 stars. My kids still love their boots though. They've worn them a lot and still holding up. I even put them in the washing machine and they held up.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Boot Soles Horrible - Done in One Use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the size 7 for our 11 year old and they are very comfortable to wear. Going into the snow was a happy occassion that lasted for about 15 minutes, because once in the snow, the soles started shredding into fuzzy felt-like threads! What we thought were rubber soles are something very flimsy entirely. Now, the snow clings in clumps to the bottom of the boots, making it impossible to walk safely on snow and ice. This is uncomfortable and dangerous. The shoes are now useless, despite being comfortable on the inside. Truly disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy parent

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Great price, for a great pair of boots. I love the front string that helps tighten the boot around the calf rather then just the velcro wear it doesnt tighten if your childs legs are tiny. Very durable and kept my girls feet extremely well covered and warm during the time they played in the snow. Highly recomend
customer_reviews.author: Aamommy5286

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, but the design...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5, but, in my opinion, the design of these boots is a bit problematic. Once water gets inside them (my kids wore them on a very rainy day), it is very hard to get the boots dry. we didn't know that and we noticed a stinky smell coming from all that water that was inside the boots for just over a day. I had to keep these in the sun for several days (suspended upside down) for the boots to dry completely
customer_reviews.author: Glo

customer_reviews.title: Great Snow Boots for baby & kids!
customer_reviews.text: Love these kids snow boots! Make sure to order a size up because they do run a little small. My son has very long and wide feet for his age so i ordered a size up and they fit perfect! He is 1 years old and was able to walk around in them with ease. They are not super heavy but they do have some weight to them. The VELCRO is a MUST for snow boots with kids, that's why I bought these. Please save yourself the time and stress and do not buy baby snow boots with laces, I promise you will regret it. Love these boots! Will buy again for our next snow trip next year!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High end without price tag
customer_reviews.text: Best boots we’ve bought in awhile. The best part is I didn’t spend 100 each on the twins boots but they are JUST as nice as if I did. Easily comparable to all the big names. WILL be buying this brand again, thank you for the quality affordable option!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: NikkiBaj

customer_reviews.title: great quality toddler winter boots!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! They’re easy to put on, they stay on, they’re warm and they have good traction! You couldn’t ask for a better boot for a toddler. I loved them when my daughter was 18 months, and I ordered them again this year and again am so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kalyn

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These boots are a good value for the price - they aren't the most stylish boots, and snow can and does get inside them regardless of the bungee, but for the most part they work well and kept my son's feet dry and warm unless he was really burying himself in the snow. The sizing is good too - nice and wide to allow for thick socks!

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were such a waste of time! It was so difficult to put my daughter’s foot in there. She was suited up wearing layers of clothes that struggling to put these shoes on (she only had thermals and a thin pair of socks on her feet) was a nightmare! Don’t bother with these. We ended up purchasing Sorel snow boots at the resort (the tongue moved outward for an easy slide in and then fitted with Velcro).
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the feet warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: Perfect winter boots. Very easy to get on and off. Velcro at the ankle keeps the boot in place. Cinch at the calf keeps snow and mud out. Our son’s feet stay warm and dry no matter how long he stays out playing in the snow. They are a bit bulky for our 1.5 year old, but my older son has had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Great boot - don't be afraid to buy
customer_reviews.text: My kids only wear their boots for an hour or two at a time but within that time frame they loved the fit, feel and warm n' cozy these boots provided. These were great for going out to recess and keeping the tootsies dry and clean when they came into class. I was pleased with the construction of the boot and besides the fact my kids feet have grown like weeds, they are perfect to use again (hand-me-downs) :) I will not feel embarrassed to give these to a friend or Goodwill knowing they are in great shape. These were a great price for the durability, look and function.
customer_reviews.author: ERB

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son to play in the snow. I bought the size bigger than he is wearing (I'm hoping to get a second season out of them). He never complained about cold feet, or about them being uncomfortable. Easy to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: ChristerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Once we got the right item it was perfect.
customer_reviews.text: We originally received the completely wrong item (boys New Balance running shoes). Sent a complaint and received the correct boots. They fit great. My daughter loves them. They have features to make them fit any foot size it seems (two adjustments at ankle then at calf). They’ve done a good job so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy access for a squirmy toddler with chubby feet
customer_reviews.text: These were the winners of the many pairs of boots I ordered for my toddler, even over name brands like Sorel and Kamik. My almost 2-year old has very big feet for his age, but they are still shaped a little like thick chubby baby feet, so it's hard to get boots on and off. Between the drawstring and the velcro, these are easy to get on but then can be closed to tightly keep snow and cold out.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots!  Well made.
customer_reviews.text: These are really great boots. Bought a similar looking pair at a big box store a few years back and the shaft of those sagged and did not stay upright. These have structure, are well made and warm. They have a highly reflective strip running up the back for safety that I didn't notice in the description but was a pleasant surprise since, in the north, the boys will be walking to the bus in the dark some mornings. Well made boots and if he wasn't going to likely outgrow them before next winter, I would expect them to last more than one winter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Keeps little feet warm and dry.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the munchkin. As we are speeding through shoe sizes, I ordered a size up get get us through winter. I think this is why they seem a little hard to walk in sometimes. It can also be a bit difficult to make sure little feet are all they way in the foot part of the shoe. That being said, they work great. When we take them off, little feet are always warm and dry, and usually it hasn't sucked off the socks during wear. They are quite a bit heavier than little shoes, but the foot part is basically one piece of molded rubber, which is what keeps the feet so dry.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: After an hour in the snow my son's feet were soaked. I'm unsure if snow got in the boots or if the boots just aren't well insulated, but we haven't had this problem with other boots in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Solid boot choice
customer_reviews.text: This did well during the Arctic freeze that came through the midwest. My son was able to trot through the snow on his way to school. They're comfortable, they keep his feet dry, they fit well so no complaints. Also design is kinda cute. Will buy these again in the future if he ever outgrows em.
customer_reviews.author: Blushed22

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: These are decent boots for kids. Easy to put on and take off. If you cinch the top string very tight it helps keep snow from getting into the boot but it's not 100% reliable as typical child movement loosens its grip too easily. (We use gaiters on all our kids to keep snow out of their boots) My only complaint is that snow tends to clump up on the bottom of the boot. It was frustrating for our 5 year old as she would have "high heels" as she put it on the bottom of the boots. We had to constantly bang off the clumps so she was able to walk around.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Fredlake

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and warm
customer_reviews.text: This is our third pair of these boots and we love them. Affordable, warm, and easy on and off. We’ve had them for both kids and the boy’s has lasted two seasons. Girl had a growth spurt so we needed new ones and came back for the same ones since she loved her last pair.
customer_reviews.author: A. Britton

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our son who is almost 4 to go on a winter trip to Colorado. They were fantastic! He went sledding and his feet stayed warm and dry every day. They were very easy to put on and take off. They were easy for him to walk in too and he said they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to get on and off. Kid seems to have no issues walking in them and appear to keep him warm and dry (granted he can't really communicate this to us directly). We are very pleased with the boots and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Boot - Injured my Daughter
customer_reviews.text: These boots are dangerous for kids. The snow packs under the tread and creates a dense snowball for your child to walk on. I thought this was a fluke with a heavy snow we had when my daughter was playing outside, but we had a lighter snow of just an inch and the same thing happened. My daughter wore the boots, walked from the car into school with a giant snowball under each foot and fell injuring her face on the floor. Spend up for better boots, little kids need something that functions correctly in snow and shouldn't have to worry about clearing a giant mound of compacted snow from the bottom of their boot.
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: it's annoying. She doesn't have trouble walking in any other ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess can't complain to much because of the price but my daughter makes so much noise walking in these boots, it's annoying. She doesn't have trouble walking in any other shoes so I know it isn't her fault. Also the elastic tightener broke and went inside the boot just after wearing them a few times
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Good kids' boots
customer_reviews.text: My 5yo daughter really likes these. They're comfortable and appear to keep her feet warm and dry. She does need to pull her snowpant cuffs down over the boot so as not to get snow down the inside. But we really like them for daily play!
customer_reviews.author: mrbp

customer_reviews.title: Solid boots
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy boys’ boot with good traction. I can’t tell how it holds up in the snow, we didn’t get a chance to find out, but I am still pleased with the purchase. My fabric-sensitive son hasn’t complained about them being uncomfortable, also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Foarde

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put on
customer_reviews.text: Really difficult to get on my toddlers feet. I wouldn’t recommend unless you’re child can push and get on their own shoes... my 20 month old is still wobbly legged and not stiff enough to make these easy. I ended up returning and finding a better alternative
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dry socks and warm toes!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great especially for the price! I procrastinated on getting my daughter her snow boots this year and these were shipped prime and perfect! I did get them a size bigger so we could put thick socks on her and they fit perfectly! She has spent lots of time playing in the snow and always comes in with dry socks and warm toes.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. Well made and have stood up to daily wear this winter. The shaft of the boot is not floppy like other of this style I have purchased for the boys. There seems to be a decent layer of insulation in the shaft that gives it enough stiffness to stand up straight without being uncomfortable. My son likes them and says they are warm. They keep his feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Cute
customer_reviews.text: These fit my daughter as-expected and were so comfortable and cute on her. We only got a few uses out of them since it didn't snow much, but we liked them enough that we're going to purchase the next size up for this coming winter.
customer_reviews.author: mandalin

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival the box was damaged, therefore could not give as a gift. The tags attached to the boots stated that these are insulated and rated for extremely cold weather. However, there's no way! Looking at the boots, there is a thin piece of foam in the boots and the outsole (bottom) is some kind of cheapo plastic. These boots would not last a weekend!!
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: keeping toes warm...
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to review these because my son who is 11 months old is wearing them... but they seemed to do the trick. We were having a hard time keeping his feet warm when we would walk in the winter. He is not walking in the snow, but just riding along. They have a lot of insulation and seem to keep his toes warm enough. They are very heavy, so I don't know if he could walk in them, but that wasn't our main point of getting them. The price was also right and I feel it is helping him.
customer_reviews.author: Bootlover

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price - dont keep feet dry though
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the green snowboard pattern and did one size up so my son can grow into them more throughout the Winter. Love them so far and so does he! -Update: once the snow came and some rain, weve found that these shoes let some water in... our sons socks have been damp multiple times. Disappointing. Wish that we could send them back.
customer_reviews.author: A Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair of these boots purchased for our toddler. Great solid construction, keep his feet toasty warm AND dry here in Maine. Easy slip on and off, but not too easy that they fall off walking and playing around while outside.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. McGhee

customer_reviews.title: ... packs to the bottom of them leaving the child like they are trying to balance while walking on stilts
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the boot seems okay however not worth the risk they cause as the snow packs to the bottom of them leaving the child like they are trying to balance while walking on stilts. I seriously cannot believe these boots have good reviews. I'm not impressed!
customer_reviews.author: A.Frazier

customer_reviews.title: fashionable winter shoes that are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for what we wanted. They are nicely insulated and have a very cute pattern. They were worn in winter rain, snow and tracking through the woods and held up great. the rubber part around the bottom is very stiff and will protect your foot from feeling much of anything if stepped on or worse. I used all purpose natural cleaner to wipe all the dirt off and they cleaned up pretty good considering. I hope they fit a while, i bought them a few sizes to big on purpose to be worn more than one winter. I would highly recommend them and am very satiated with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Zero flexibility
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very difficult to get on my 17 month old's feet as the rubber bottoms are so stiff they won't bend, where the ankle should go is a tiny non-flexible opening and there is little wiggle room in the boots themselves. When we thought we finally had them on his feet correctly, he took a few steps and they were sideways on his feet as his foot never properly fit in. I wish I had my toddler try them on as soon as I ordered them rather than waiting for the first snow fall so I could have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Worman

customer_reviews.title: I like the fit very much
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased these boots for my daughter. I like the fit very much. They fit a little snug so she may stuggle with thick socks. I like the tighter fit though, that's what we want to keep the snow from going down into her ankles. Only slight drawback-I wish the boot was maybe just an inch or so tallet on her calf. Luckily, her snowpants are longer. Overall great boot esp for the price :)
customer_reviews.author: Amy Peters

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but run small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my 18mo daughter and i went a couple sizes up so the last long, but the ankle portion of the boot is extremely skinny. My daughter is very small and thin but these are practically impossible to get on especially with several pairs of socks on and pants. They just don't make sense. The boot is vey good quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice winter boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of these boots. I found them to be true to size for my kids. Orders 1 size up, am getting 2 years out of one pair as they were big last year (but wearable) and the little one grew too much so needed to size up. My girls loved these, they keep their feet dry and warm for use on our skip trip, and fit fine with our winter socks. Not too expensive and cute. I'm surprised by the negative reviews. However I can't speak for daily use durability as we live in Florida and only use them one week a year for a ski trip.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm And Soft
customer_reviews.text: Ive been on the hunt for some good durable long lasting and warm winter boots for my 5 year old. He firstly observed that they were soft and warm! he tried them on and after walking for a while in them he said they'll do! Pretty happy with my purchase. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for both of my sons. They LOVE the boots. They claim they fit perfect, allow them to run on the playground and keep their feet plenty warm. In inspecting the boots, they are very warm, and fit up to the expectations of the advertised boots. They look and feel as expected. I would highly recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Milyvanily

customer_reviews.title: Toddler boots-looks and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for my grandson to wear out in the winter weather. I liked the way they looked and fit on him. He's 18 months old so no feedback from him but what I could tell they are just what I had hoped to receive when I ordered them. The only thing I had to guess on was arch support. All other aspects are spot on. I'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boots for winter!
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly! They held up and were awesome for our first South Dakota winter snow. It also held up against the weird toddler strength of my son trying to destroy them.
customer_reviews.author: Megan B

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.  No need to look further.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried “name brands” and these are just as good and priced fine. I live in a state where we get snow 1-3 times a year. When it comes the kids MUST go out and play, so this item is a must have for me.
customer_reviews.author: savvydiva

customer_reviews.title: Cute but Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: The boot seems very sturdy and will definitely last but my one negative review is that the boots are so heavy! My 18month old has an incredibly hard time walking around with these on. I plan on keeping them as it’s cold and there’s snow on the ground and I need boots for her but that is my one complaint about them.
customer_reviews.author: Charliegirl18

customer_reviews.title: Second pair, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Well made boot! My son had a pair when he was younger that lasted forever. We decided to buy the same brand this year in his size. No search need, good purchase for the snow and ice!
customer_reviews.author: Ossie

product_meta.title: Northside Boys Girls Toddler/Little Kids/Big Kids Frosty Winter Snow Boot
product_meta.description:
This snow boot from Northside features all-weather protection and a toasty layer of insulation.
BOOT FEATURES
• Waterproof lightweight TPR shell bottom
• Reflective hell pull
• Adjustable bungee & elastic toggle closure
• Hook & loop midfoot strap
• Durable rubber traction sole
• Thermolite insulation
BOOT CONSTRUCTION
• Nylon upper
• Fabric lining
• Manmade outsole
BOOT DETAILS
• Round toe
• Pull on
• Thermal lining
• Shaft measures approximately 8" from arch


Rock-solid fashions for the family on the go. Whether it's cold-weather boots or rugged sandals, Northside is all about keeping families moving. The products are built to withstand what today's active families throw at them, or on them. Available in the latest styles, materials and colors, these shoes offer flattering silhouettes with great features like quick-draw lacing, toe guards and traction soles. In fact, Northside all-season footwear offers the features of higher-priced brands, without the high price tag. Finally, there's family footwear to get excited about.
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately mid-calf from arch
Rugged tall 7 inch mid calf upper features padded nylon panels/adventurous prints/lightweight waterproof rubber shell with fully insulated lining
This cold weather snow boot offers water resistant construction with quick drying lining to keep little feet dry; An adjustable toggle collar keep debris out
Removable/washable cushioned EVA insole/padded lining offer extra cushioning for little feet; premier 200 gram Thinsulate insulation keeps your feet warm
Hook and loop strap allows for secure adjustments; elastic toggle collar ensures customized fit; reflective heel pull strap is a great safety feature that makes it easy to get on/off
Durable Lightweight multi directional outsole ensures traction/shock absorption/good abrasion resistance in snowy or icy conditions
